statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.description: Shawn Prudhomme made eight 3-pointers and scored 37 points -- both career highs -- on Tuesday night to help Southern beat NAIA-member Paul Quinn 91-79.
article.headline: Prudhomme has career-high 37, Southern beats NAIA Paul Quinn
article.linkText: Prudhomme has career-high 37, Southern beats NAIA Paul Quinn
article.story: BATON ROUGE, La. -- Shawn Prudhomme made eight 3-pointers and scored 37 points -- both career highs -- on Tuesday night to help Southern beat NAIA-member Paul Quinn 91-79. Jared Sam added 20 points, 13 rebounds and four blocks for the Jaguars (2-3), who pulled away with 15 straight points capped by one of Prudhomme's 3s for a 79-61 lead with 4:33 left. The Tigers got the deficit no closer than 13 from there. JaMarcus Weatherspoon scored 10 and Tre'lun Banks had eight points and 10 assists for Southern. Blake Ervin and Jalen Johnson led Paul Quinn with 17 points each. Sirpatrick Reynolds added 15 points and Ashley Brooks scored 11. The Tigers had the lead as late as 29-28 with 4:16 left in the first half and trailed by four at the break. They closed to within 64-61 with 8:35 left in the game.
